content.text: Welcome to a 'koffietentje' (a cozy coffee shop) in the Netherlands. You're about to order your first coffee. Let's start with a simple greeting.
'Graag' makes a request polite, similar to adding 'please'. It literally means 'gladly'.

content.title: Greet and Get Attention
content.setting: You're at the front of the line in a cozy coffee shop. The friendly barista smiles at you.

conversation_flow.title: Greet the barista and say you'd like to order.

data.tip: The 'ee' in 'verkeerd' sounds like the 'ay' in the English word 'say'.

content.text: 'Koffie Verkeerd' literally means 'wrong coffee' because it has more milk than coffee. It's a very common and mild coffee drink.
The barista will ask 'hier opdrinken of meenemen?'. You only need to reply with your choice, for example: 'Hier opdrinken'.

content.title: Order Your Drink
content.setting: Now that you have the barista's attention, it's time to place your order.

conversation_flow.title: Say it's 'for here'.
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Oké, een koffie verkeerd. Is dat voor hier opdrinken of om mee te nemen?

data.Pinnen: To pay with a debit card

content.text: 'Pinnen' is a verb that specifically means to pay with a debit card and PIN. Asking 'Kan ik pinnen?' is the most common way to ask to pay by card.

content.title: Pay for Your Coffee
content.setting: You've ordered your coffee. Now it's time to pay and receive your drink.

conversation_flow.title: Ask how much it is.
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Prima, een koffie verkeerd voor hier.

conversation_flow.title: Ask if you can pay by card ('pinnen').
